intro: Vernonia wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically reaches heights of 1 to 3 meters and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. The genus Vernonia is part of the sunflower family, Asteraceae, and is known for its medicinal and ornamental uses.
